text.title: Have Great Conversation at Family Dinners
text.head: Have Great Conversation at Family Dinners
text.p: Many sons and daughters have dreaded coming home from either school or work because of the inevitable family dinner conversations . Who knows , you might end up next to your great-aunt Kate who blabs on and on about her cats or next to cousin Joey who rightfully earned his title of prank king . Read this article to have an easier time , and you might find yourself enjoying these dinners !
text.head: Steps
Review the Seating

list.item: Consider whether there is some rivalry in the family . Or , do some people just not fit together ? If that is the case , make sure they sit on opposite sides of the table !
Try to steer the mood towards being a happy one . Who likes to chat with a nemesis for a whole night ? Also , it might turn out to be dangerous ...
Sit in a comfortable environment . Put yourself next to friends and people you have no problem being yourself with .
Have a corner for children . It 's very annoying when little kids bug you for the whole dinner , so make sure that they have toys to play with and other kids to scream with .

text.head: Always Have an Escape

list.item: Plan the escape . Inevitably , there are the casualties , so make sure that if you end up with a very boring or annoying person as your side person , that you have an escape . Some ideas are offered next , to help you .
Fake a call . You can say that your friend is in a homework crisis , or be even less confidential and simply say it 's important .

Say you want to check on your 3-year-old cousin , or in certain cases , your son . Kids are a great diversion from family dinners , because they need so much care and attention . Watch out though , you might find yourself spending the rest of the night with little Johnny !
Use the restrooms . If you desperately need to go to the bathroom , nobody could force you to stay . Just make sure you do n't stay away for too long .

text.head: Bring Another Person in the Conversation

list.item: If you are having trouble keeping the conversation going , include someone else . Group chats can be so much easier and enjoyable , because you can just lay back and listen ( or not ) .

text.head: Being properly engaged

list.item: Make eye contact . Many people expect you to be making eye contact , so do that .
Stand up straight . This basically shows the person respect .
Do n't be the one to end the conversation if you do n't have a proper excuse . The person might come back later and wo n't give up until you 've heard it all .

Be funny . It is so much more enjoyable to talk to a funny person ! Make jokes and laugh when necessary , but make sure you do n't overdo it .
Laugh even when you do n't get the joke , it makes people feel appreciated .
Be a good audience . Nod when you have to , cry when you have to , and even yell if necessary ! The talker needs a confidence booster to keep his or her story interesting on both sides .
Be polite . Do n't interrupt unless the speaker asks you a question .
Find a good topic to talk about . It 's so much easier to speak if both parties are interested and involved in the conversation .
Do n't be negative . Do n't try to see everything at a bad angle , it makes the environment worse for you and the other guests . Try to enjoy yourself , and most of the time you will .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Be yourself ! Do n't brag about something that 's not true , because it 's hard to keep up a lie with your family . Plus , nobody judges or hates you at family dinners , it 's your family !

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Do n't be too loud or evasive . Do n't draw too much attention to yourself , but not too little either , it 's rude in both ways .
